title: Bob Heffner
text:
Robert Frederic Heffner (born September 13, 1938) nicknamed "Butch", is an <a href="Americans">American</a> former <a href="professional%20baseball">professional baseball</a> <a href="right-handed">right-handed</a> <a href="pitcher">pitcher</a>. Heffner appeared in <a href="Major%20League%20Baseball">Major League Baseball</a> (MLB) for the <a href="Boston%20Red%20Sox">Boston Red Sox</a> (–), <a href="Cleveland%20Indians">Cleveland Indians</a> (), and <a href="Los%20Angeles%20Angels">California Angels</a> (). He stood tall and weighed , in his playing days.
Bob was born in Allentown, PA and graduated from <a href="William%20Allen%20High%20School">Allentown High School</a> in 1957. He was signed by the <a href="Boston%20Red%20Sox">Boston Red Sox</a> as an amateur free agent on June 12, 1957 out of high school.
Throughout his big league career, Heffner was used both as <a href="starting%20pitcher">starter</a> and <a href="relief%20pitcher">reliever</a>. His most productive season came in with the Red Sox, when he posted career-highs in <a href="win%20%28baseball%29">wins</a> (seven, including a <a href="shutout">shutout</a>), <a href="strikeout">strikeout</a>s (112), <a href="save%20%28baseball%29">saves</a> (six), <a href="games%20pitched">games</a> (55), and <a href="innings%20pitched">innings</a> (158-2/3).
Hefner's five-season MLB career totals include an 11–21 <a href="Win%E2%80%93loss%20record%20%28pitching%29">W–L record</a>, a 4.51 <a href="earned%20run%20average">ERA</a>, and six <a href="save%20%28baseball%29">saves</a>. Overall, he appeared in 114 games, 31 of which were as a starter.
